content.raw:
I agree that synchronizing urdfs between [multisense_ros](https://bitbucket.org/hsu/multisense_ros) and [drcsim](#!/osrf/drcsim) repos is a good idea.

Having a fixed joint should work, but I have a couple of questions:

 1. Does Atlas robot simulation need an urdf that contains the 12 continuous calibration joints in `multisense_ros`?  If so, please list the usage so we can help come up with a solution here.
 1. With or without the calibration joints in the drcsim urdf, we can add 12 static tf publishers to broadcast transforms for each of the calibration joints and corresponding frames.  This should cover the case where teams software modules might be expecting these transforms.  Is doing so sufficient for current simulation use cases?

Thanks.
